summary: This is an email chain from August 16, 2019, showing internal FBI communication regarding a media inquiry from The Sun newspaper. The inquiry states the FBI intends to interview Prince Andrew as part of the wider Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking conspiracy investigation. The FBI's public affairs specialist declines to comment.

persons.name: Amy J. Thoreson
persons.context: FBI Public Affairs Specialist in New York who receives and forwards a media inquiry about the Prince Andrew/Epstein investigation, stating the FBI has no comment.

persons.name: James Beal
persons.context: US Editor for The Sun newspaper who sends an email to the FBI's national press office seeking comment on a story that the FBI intends to interview Prince Andrew as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: British royal who is stated in a media inquiry to be one of the individuals the FBI intends to interview as part of the wider conspiracy investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking operation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the sex trafficking operation investigation, to which Prince Andrew is linked as part of the wider conspiracy probe.

connections.description: Prince Andrew is linked to Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking operation investigation, with the FBI reportedly intending to interview him as part of the wider conspiracy probe.
Thoreson, as an FBI Public Affairs Specialist, is the recipient of Beal's media inquiry and responds that the FBI has no comment.

events.title: Media Inquiry on FBI Interview of Prince Andrew
events.description: James Beal of The Sun emails the FBI's national press office stating the newspaper intends to run a story that the FBI is intending to talk to Prince Andrew as part of the wider Epstein sex trafficking conspiracy investigation.

keyFacts: On August 16, 2019, The Sun newspaper contacted the FBI seeking comment on a story that the FBI intended to interview Prince Andrew regarding the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking conspiracy investigation.
The FBI's Public Affairs Specialist, Amy J. Thoreson, declined to comment on the inquiry.
The media inquiry explicitly states Prince Andrew was 'one of a number of individuals the FBI is to seek an interview with' in the wider Epstein probe.
The document reveals ongoing FBI investigative activity regarding high-profile associates of Jeffrey Epstein in August 2019.
